para.text: The Mayor may issue rebates to a property owner or lessee of a building in the District who, after October 1, 2022:

Purchases and installs an AED in a publicly accessible location in the interior of a building owned or leased by the property owner or lessee, respectively, within 150 feet from the building's entrance;
Registers the AED with the Fire and Emergency Medical Services Department;
Submits a rebate claim that includes such information and documentation as may be required by the Mayor; and
Meets any additional requirements and criteria established by rules issued by the Mayor pursuant to § 7-2371.05.
The rebates issued pursuant to subsection (a) of this section shall not exceed $400 for each AED installed in a building, with a maximum rebate of up to $750 per building.
Notwithstanding paragraph (1) of this subsection, the amount of a rebate shall not exceed the purchase price of the AED.
Rebates issued pursuant to this section shall:
Be contingent upon the availability of funds; and
Not be considered income for purposes of District income tax.

annotations.annotation: For temporary (90 days) creation of this section, see § 5a of Fiscal Year 2023 Budget Support Emergency Act of 2022 (D.C. Act 24-470, July 13, 2022, 69 DCR 008707).
